abstract: With the fall television season shaking out, the critics Mike Hale and Neil Genzlinger are taking your questions.
snippet: With the fall television season shaking out, the critics Mike Hale and Neil Genzlinger are taking your questions.
lead_paragraph: Now that viewers have gotten a look at most of the new shows this season, the fall television picture is becoming clearer: sitcoms like "New Girl" (with Zooey Deschanel) and "2 Broke Girls" (with Kat Dennings) have gotten votes of confidence, Tim Allen's "Last Man Standing" earned a spot in the Top 30, while "H8R," "Free Agents" and "How to Be a Gentleman" are out or on their way. Did these shows deserve their fates, for better or worse? Speaking of comedies, HBO unveiled "Enlightened" and came back with a new season of "Bored to Death" and a male breast-feeding scene. Has HBO finally gone too far? The television critics Mike Hale and Neil Genzlinger have posted answers to your questions and comments.
